Testimonials
“I feel very fortunate to have found Petter! His teaching is creative, encouraging and very inspirational. Each week I come away feeling totally amazed by what i have achieved in the lesson. I highly recommend him!” - Carmela Gianfagna

“Petter is a very focused and present teacher, who has led me through some of my most hardcore obstacles in my music with ease, and I can strongly recommend him to everyone that wants to get through with music. He’s is crazy, brave and it’s easy to feel that all he wishes for is for me to succeed!” - Johan Ransby Granberg

"Petter has an untamed creativity. His style is wonderful and wild. He helped me harness my own musicality and took me on an organic journey of discovery" – Jacqueline Abbey

"I had very limited song writing knowledge before working with Petter. But through the techniques and exercises we did he gave me confidence I never expected! He always pushed me and made sure I was doing the best I could do, and not just settling for ok. He taught me to always finish a song, even if I’ve decided I hate it, because finishing a song is the hardest part. I’m so proud of the pieces I wrote while working with Petter, and he always gave me ideas and techniques I’d have never thought of to continually develop and progress every part of every song. And also every lesson was fun! He’s really easy to talk to and I couldn’t recommend him more!" – Kristy Cromwell Leigh
about me
I'm Petter Rylén, a Swedish songwriter, pianist and producer. I got my masters degree in Music Performance in 2015 from the Rhythmic Music Conservatory in Copenhagen, and have since been working as a touring musician, composer and music educator.

If you’re curious to know more about me I would recommend checking out my albums, or watching my videos, about how I make music.
questions
How many spots do you have? I currently only have space for 5 more students.
What do I need?
  • A device that can do video calls.
  • Daily access to either:
    • a chord instrument (piano, guitar, etc).
    • OR a computer with a music making program (Ableton, Logic, Fruity Loops etc) + basic recording equipment.
  • Some spare time to work on your songs.
What if I’m not good enough?
You are! My methods are about doing our best with whatever means we have at hand, discovering how easy it is to write songs, and the enjoyment of trying things we don't think we can do.
I don’t want to sing?
No problem, as long as you don’t mind me telling you to try it anyway.
How do I sign up?
Send me an email and I will get back to you with my availability! Before your first lesson, in order to help you as much as possible, I will ask you to tell me more about yourself by filling in this form. You can also sign up by filling in the form straight away.
How do I pay?
Paypal (or Swish if you live in Sweden).
What days do you teach?
Wednesdays and Thursdays.
contact
